required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Visits at Brigham and Women's Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Virtual Visits at Brigham and Women's Hospital: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Clinicians slated for virtual visit rollout will be randomized (stratified by department) to either receive immediate virtual visit on-boarding (intervention arm) or delayed (3-months later) virtual visit on-boarding (control arm). The investigators plan to enroll no more than 200 clinicians.
Any clinician in a department selected by the Brigham Health Virtual Care team for access to virtual visits is eligible, unless s/he saw less than 20 patients monthly over the last 6 months.
The Brigham Health Virtual Care team will onboard all clinicians and provide virtual visit support as per their usual protocol. The primary study endpoint is third-available appointment, a well-adopted measure of access. Other secondary endpoints revolve around continuity, efficiency, utilization, safety, cost, and patient experience.

detailed_description.textblock:
If enrolled in the intervention arm, the following steps will occur:
- The clinician will receive the intervention arm follow-up email ("Follow-up Email - Intervention" in the Appendix).
- The Brigham Health Virtual Care team will work with the clinician toward immediate on-boarding (software training, hardware setup, technical support) as per their usual process.
- The clinician will schedule virtual visits as s/he and/or her/his department see fit. Virtual visits occur on an already-in-use Partners- and Brigham-approved video platform (attached).
If enrolled in the control arm, the following steps will occur:
- The clinician will receive the control arm follow-up email ("Follow-up Email - Control" in the Appendix).
- Three months from the time of the follow-up email, the Brigham Health Virtual Care team will work with the clinician toward immediate on-boarding (software training, hardware setup, technical support) as per their usual process.
- The clinician will schedule virtual visits as s/he and/or her/his department see fit. Virtual visits occur on an already-in-use Partners- and Brigham-approved video platform (attached).
The investigators plan to follow patients of both clinician cohorts for a total of 6-months. The investigators will perform retrospective review of patient electronic health records and patients will receive a redcap survey (attached), an evaluation mechanism already employed by the Virtual Care team.
Again, aside from the initial randomization and retrospective data collection and analysis, all of the above would have occurred irrespective of this research protocol.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Clinicians slated for virtual visit rollout will be randomized (stratified by department) to either receive immediate virtual visit on-boarding (intervention arm) or delayed (3-months later) virtual visit on-boarding (control arm).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Number of days until the third available routine appointment, obtained at 12 o'clock each Friday (embargoed appointments not included). The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's average number of days until the third available routine appointment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days until the next available routine appointment, obtained at 12 o'clock each Friday (embargoed appointments not included). The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's average number of days until the next available routine appointment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Future capacity: percentage of open appointment slots
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of appointment slots that are open and available for booking patients over the next four weeks, obtained at 12 o'clock each Friday (embargoed appointments not included). The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's future capacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of visits with the usual provider of care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of visits to the most frequently seen provider to the total number of visits to all providers obtained each month. The mean of all of the months is a clinician's ratio.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The number of visits to each individual physician divided by the total number of visits the patient had overall obtained each month. The mean of all of the months is the continuity of care index

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of no-show visits to total visit slots obtained each week. The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's no show rate.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: In-person: face time with patient per pertinent EHR fields, obtained each week. The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's visit time. Virtual: enter virtual waiting room to video stops, obtained each week. The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's visit time.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patients seen per hour, calculated at the end of the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patients seen per day, all calculated at the end of the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patients seen per month, all calculated at the end of the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patients seen per 6 months, all calculated at the end of the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of used slots to total slots, obtained each week. The mean of all of the weeks is a clinician's slot utilization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of primary care visits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of specialist visits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of emergency department visits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of inpatient admissions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of imaging studies ordered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of laboratory studies ordered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of medications prescribed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sent electronically within 1 week of the in-person or virtual visit
secondary_outcome.description: Brigham Health Virtual Care team survey sent to participating patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Revenue from virtual or in-person visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Revenue garnered by an individual clinician for her/his clinical activity, calculated per hour and per 6 months (denominator: total clinical hours worked).

arm_group.description: If enrolled in the intervention arm, the following steps will occur: The Brigham Health Virtual Care team will work with the clinician toward immediate on-boarding (software training, hardware setup, technical support) as per their usual process. The clinician will schedule virtual visits as s/he and/or her/his department see fit. Virtual visits occur on an already-in-use Partners- and Brigham-approved video platform.

If enrolled in the control arm, the following steps will occur: Three months from the time of the follow-up email, the Brigham Health Virtual Care team will work with the clinician toward immediate on-boarding (software training, hardware setup, technical support) as per their usual process. The clinician will schedule virtual visits as s/he and/or her/his department see fit. Virtual visits occur on an already-in-use Partners- and Brigham-approved video platform.

intervention.description: Clinicians will have a synchronous video visit with their patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinician whose department is chosen for virtual visit rollout
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinician who saw on average fewer than 20 patients monthly over the past 6 months
- Clinician who opts out of virtual visits

reference.citation: Wootton R. Twenty years of telemedicine in chronic disease management--an evidence synthesis. J Telemed Telecare. 2012 Jun;18(4):211-20. doi: 10.1258/jtt.2012.120219. Review.

McLean S, Sheikh A, Cresswell K, Nurmatov U, Mukherjee M, Hemmi A, Pagliari C. The impact of telehealthcare on the quality and safety of care: a systematic overview. PLoS One. 2013 Aug 19;8(8):e71238. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0071238. eCollection 2013. Review.
Dorsey ER, Topol EJ. State of Telehealth. N Engl J Med. 2016 Jul 14;375(2):154-61. doi: 10.1056/NEJMra1601705. Review.
